name: 10.18 "License to Hill" Online Trivia | 'Cheers'- Season 10 | 10 Questions

questions.correct: She wasn't with him last night.
options: She spent the night with him.
She told him she loved him.
questions.explanation:
She wasn't with him last night.

	John Hill and Carla have a love-hate relationship. They can't stand each other, but love to have sex with each other.

questions.text: What did John say he'd do if the barflies "behaved themselves the next couple of hours"?
questions.explanation:
Take them for ice cream.

	John had no respect for Sam or the Cheers patrons. His tone was very condescending, like he was speaking to some children.

questions.text: What did Sam say into the vent so John's customers would hear it?
questions.correct: Eek, there's a rat, there's a big rat!
options: I heard the food was poisonous!
Run for your lives! It's alive!
questions.explanation:
Eek, there's a rat, there's a big rat!.

	John was furious when he came down. He told Sam he looked forward to the day he could have Cheers shut down.

questions.text: Who said he never played poker before?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	He said he's played a lot of games but never poker. Norm said that it was time Woody learned to play poker.

questions.text: When Rebecca asked Sam what she did at Cheers, how did he respond?
questions.correct: Hey, don't back me in a corner here.
options: If you don't know, how should I know?
questions.explanation:
Hey, don't back me in a corner here.

	Rebecca thought Sam thought she was useless.  Sam told her she was very valuable doing all the things she did.

questions.text: Where did the guys have their poker game?
options: At one of the tables where the bar was
questions.explanation:
Pool room.

	They were smoking cigars. Frasier said, "There's nothing like a good cigar...and this is nothing like a good cigar."

questions.text: Who was trying to hustle the other players?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	He told them this before they started playing. They thought he still wouldn't be any good because he was playing in the city now.

questions.text: Rebecca received a letter; what was it?
questions.correct: A liquor license renewal application that was returned.
options: An invitation to the bar managers' ball.
A note saying she was fired.
A certificate saying Cheers was the best bar in Boston.
questions.explanation:
A liquor license renewal application that was returned.

	This was a problem since they were a bar and served alcohol. Rebecca got around it by not really serving alcohol that evening.

questions.text: Who did Rebecca agree to go on a date with?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Paul was going to tell Sam about the liquor license, so Paul was blackmailing her. Sam told her she should consider computer dating.

questions.text: Whose fault was it that the liquor license renewal got returned?
questions.explanation:
Sam's.

	Sam blamed Rebecca and she blamed herself. However, it was discovered Sam didn't pay enough postage because stamps went up from 25 cents to 29 cents.
